compiler
Class GameFunction

java.lang.Object
  compiler.GameFunction

public class GameFunction
extends java.lang.Object

GameCommand is a class that holds the Game Function itself, as defined by Token and the parameters to that game function call. EXAMPLE: isNextEnemy(z) isNextEnemy is the game function z is the first and only parameter

Author:
Michael Pinnegar

Field Summary
private  java.lang.String gameFunctionID
          The name of the game function to be called.
private  Parameters parameters
          List of parameters that belong to the game function.
 
Constructor Summary
GameFunction(TextFile body, Token gameFunctionAlreadyPulledOff)
          Class constructor that builds a GameFunction object from the source code found in body, and the name of the Game Function found in gameFunctionAlreadyPulledOff.
 
Method Summary
 void compile(TextFile flag)
          Adds the VMC representation of this game function call to the compiled code.
(package private)  void print()
          Prints out the elements of this game function as they were taken in as source code.

clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

Constructor Detail

GameFunction

public GameFunction(TextFile body,
                    Token gameFunctionAlreadyPulledOff)
Class constructor that builds a GameFunction object from the source code found in body, and the name of the Game Function found in gameFunctionAlreadyPulledOff. EXAMPLE: isNextEnemy(x,z) gameOrderAlreadyPulledOff = isNextEnemy

Parameters:
body - source code
gameFunctionAlreadyPulledOff - name of function
Method Detail

compile

public void compile(TextFile flag)
Adds the VMC representation of this game function call to the compiled code.

Parameters:
flag - unfinished compiled code

print

void print()
Prints out the elements of this game function as they were taken in as source code. Useful for verifying that the intermediate tree structure has been built correctly.
